availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky
County of Henry } sct.

I, David Fitzgerald, being first sworn, do say that on the night of the 9th Decr 1862 about the hour of midnight, I saw forty or fifty men near the jail of the county of Henry, saw lights about the jail, and learned on this morning that a prisoner confined in jail on a charge of murder, named Wm. D. Mitchell had been released from confinement and taken off by the men who came to the jail --
Sworn to and subscribed before me this 10th day of December 1862
Jno. A. Monfort P J H c c
